dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 19.5 × 12.8 cm (7 11/16 × 5 1/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Collector stamp and date in brown ink, verso upper left: W. Koller (Lugt 1583) 1858
inscribed:
Imperial privilege at upper left: Cum privil. Sa. / Cae. Mtis

Signed, upper right: Jac. Matham / Goltz. ÿ privignus / sculp. 

In margin around medallion: HGOLTZIUS SCVLPTOR ET PICTOR. AET. LIX.

Date of death below portrait, lower center: Obytanno CIC. ICI. / XVII. I. Ianne. [y of Obytanno in reverse.]  

Date, lower left and right: Anno / 1618.

Motto of Goltzius in emblem at bottom of medallion: Eer bouen Goltzius.
signed: Signature and address at upper right: Jac. Matham Goltzij privignus sculp.

texts.textentryhtml: Wilhelm Koller [?-1871, Lugt 1583]; sale of his collection, Vienna, February 5-27, 1872, lot 1986. Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
